tweets.text: @NaturalEngland @CRTContactUs @Brent_Council @EnvAgency @ChrisGPackham @WildLondon @Thames21 Welsh Harp is steeped in history and scientific importance. Great work done for decades by local conservation groups but joined-up action and funding from public & private official bodies is well overdue. No visit in 6 yrs from Natural England.

tweets.text:
#MytholmroydFAS - We're reinforcing the river bank  between White Houses & Hawksclough to provide extra protection against scour in high river flows.

To do this safely we need to close one lane on Burnley Road during working hours next week. 
#flooding 

https://t.co/HgdBp7TncO https://t.co/zPCza70bYH

Thanks @ClearlyPossible - I‚Äôm grateful to @BBCCambs @dottymcl and @markrwilliamson for shining a light on the issue - the @EnvAgency are constantly behind the curve - it is unacceptable. https://t.co/A4XU08N929

tweets.text:
We've replaced and fully tested the hydraulic ram and components at #MeadowgateRegulator within 72hrs.

@EnvAgencyYNE #FieldTeams & #Contractors continue to deliver #mainenance, #construction and #incidentresponse to help reduce flood risk. https://t.co/OeMnxlLtNN

An appeal is being made for thousands more Lime & Aspen trees for a major rewilding project in #Yorkshire. 

If you can help supply them please contact @AliDriverUK https://t.co/g07Onw0ha4

Due to heavy rain we have started to deploy Phase 1 of the #Northwich Scheme & will be erecting temporary defences at Barons Quay. This is being done as a precaution to protect the community from potential high river levels

Check your #flood risk üëâhttps://t.co/DelUfH7Qeq https://t.co/uS1SaUlRhF

Another superb partnership Project improving water quality and habitat in the #Yorkshire Esk Catchment.  
@GWKNE @YorksWildlife @CaBAtweets @EnvAgencyYNE @northyorkmoors @YorksMarineNP https://t.co/NhhHnlqd9S

If you have any concerns this evening over flooding following the heavy rainfall, please call the out of hours emergency line 01708 433999 for help or the @EnvAgency helpline on 0345 988 1188.  You can also visit https://t.co/w7D4bETcKO  for further guidance. Stay safe. https://t.co/lRw4cSH6RZ

It's been a really wet day in the borough today with continued rainfall. Our teams continue to be out across areas with flooding issues.
For urgent help, please call the out of hours emergency line 01708 433999 
You can also visit https://t.co/bbzpMam8pP  @EnvAgency https://t.co/slVqN6cOvH
@EnvAgency @EnvAgencySE this is the view of some of the storm drains you miss in Puckeridge. It‚Äôs coping for now, but one blockage (again).....  @standona120 @SpPuckeridge https://t.co/6qFaMHgWvF

@andyscargill @FriendsCoCCP @EnvAgencyNW I think it's the highest I've seen it today. I was wondering about a diversion route sign - quite a few people arrive at the flooded section and turn back rather than continuing onto the road and then the canal.
